III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff at the facility put a youth against the wall with their arm in
October or November 2024. The action was forceful and not in
alignment with training. There was another incident where the staff
was pulling a youth back from another youth and it was tightening
the youth's sweatshirt around their neck. The staff dragged the
youth on the ground for about five feet.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on February 10,
2025, and reported they had no additional information.
Lead Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on January 14, 2025. Lead Supervisor is the direct supervisor for
Staff 3. Lead Supervisor said he has never heard or seen Staff 3
pull Youth E across the ground. Lead Supervisor said he has
never seen Staff 3 push Youth E against the wall. Lead Supervisor
said he has never seen or heard of any concerns regarding Staff
3’s interactions with the youth.
Youth E was interviewed via facetime on January 16, 2025.
Youth E said she was outside near the school by some trees and
Staff 3 “picked her up and dragged her into the unit”. Youth E said
she does not know the date or day of when this occurred however
stated it was dark outside. Youth E said there were no other youth
or staff present during this incident. Youth E said she had a rash
up her back from being drug through the grass however denied
receiving medical treatment or telling anyone about the injury.
Youth E said Staff 3 also “pinned” her against a wall one time,
however, was unable to remember what date or day, or time of
day this occurred. Youth E denied any other staff or youth being
present during this incident. Youth E said she thought it may have
occurred in unit 3 or unit 5 but she was not exactly sure. Youth E
said she does not like Staff 3.
2

Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 14, 2025. Youth A said she has been in three fights with
Youth E and never has Youth E grabbed her by the sweatshirt.
Youth A said she has never seen Staff 3 place Youth E against
the wall with his arm or drag Youth E across the ground. Youth A
said Staff 3 is “bonded with everybody” noting she views him “like
a big brother”. Youth A said she has never seen any concerns
with Staff 3’s interactions with any of the youth.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 14, 2025. Youth B said she never saw Staff 3 drag Youth
E or any other youth across the ground or floor. Youth B said she
never saw or heard of Staff 3 holding Youth E or any other youth
against the wall. Youth B said she does not have any concerns
with the way Staff 3 interacts with her.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 14, 2025. Youth C said she has never seen or heard of
Staff 3 holding Youth E or any other youth against the wall. Youth
C said she has never seen or heard of Staff 3 dragging Youth E or
any other youth across the floor. Youth C said she does not
believe Staff 3 would ever physically hurt any of the youth and
referred to him as “a sweet person”.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 14, 2025. Youth D said she has never seen or heard of
Staff 3 holding Youth E or any other youth up against the wall.
Youth D said she has never seen or heard of Staff 3 dragging
Youth E or any other youth across the ground or floor. Youth D
said she has never seen Staff 3 use any physical restraint or force
with any of the youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on February 10, 2025.
Staff 1 said she has worked with Youth E and Staff 3 while at
Vassar House. Staff 1 said she never saw or heard of Staff 3
dragging Youth E or any other youth across the ground. Staff 1
said she never saw or heard of Staff 3 holding Youth E or any
other youth against the wall. Staff 1 said she never heard or saw
Staff 3 choke Youth E or any other youth. Staff 1 said she does
not have any concerns with the way in which Staff 3 interacts with
the youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on February 10, 2025.
Staff 2 said she has never seen or heard of Staff 3 holding Youth
E or any other youth up against the wall or choking them. Staff 2
3

said she has never seen or heard of Staff 3 pulling or dragging
Youth E or any other youth across the ground or floor. Staff 2 said
she has never had any concerns with Staff 3’s interactions with
the youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on February 12, 2025.
Staff 3 said he had worked at Vassar House and is now at
Clarence Fischer Center. Staff 3 said he never dragged Youth E
or any other youth across the floor or ground. Staff 3 said he
never held Youth E or any other youth against the wall or choked
them. Staff 3 said he has had to intervene with Youth E and other
youth however there have always been other staff or youth
present. Staff 3 said Youth E did not like him and made that
known so he would allow other staff to intervene with her and step
back if she was getting upset as to not make her angrier.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews there was not enough information to support a rule
violation as Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Lead Supervisor, Youth A,
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D all denied Staff 3 dragging Youth
E across the ground or holding Youth E against the wall
inappropriately.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff antagonizes youth at times by engaging in verbal exchanges
rather than ignoring or attempting to de-escalate the situation.
Investigation Interviews:
4

Complainant was interviewed via telephone on February 10,
2025, and reported they had no additional information.
Lead Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on January 14, 2025. Lead Supervisor is the direct supervisor for
Staff 3. Lead Supervisor said Staff 3 is like a “big brother” to the
youth at Vassar House and he has never seen or heard of him
antagonizing any of the youth. Lead Supervisor said Staff 3
spends time deescalating youth and will at times be direct with
them but never in a way that purposely makes them more upset.
Youth E was interviewed via facetime on January 16, 2025.
Youth E said Staff 3 would “always” cuss at her and the other
youth. Youth E said Staff 3 would call her a “dumb ass little girl”,
tell her she was “fast in the ass”, and told her she “dressed like a
ho”. Youth E said Staff 3 made these comments in front of “all” the
other youth and would talk to the other youth in the same manner.
Youth E said she told Staff 1 and Staff 2 about this however
nothing was done. Youth E said she does not like Staff 3, stating
“his cologne makes me feel uncomfortable”.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 14, 2025. Youth A said Staff 3 will “keep it real” with the
youth and “tell them like it is” which some youths do not like.
Youth A said Staff 3 does not purposely make youth angry and is
“like a big brother” to her. Youth A said Staff 3 will tell the youth
when they are messing up to help them make better choices and
is “upfront and honest” with the youth.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 14, 2025. Youth B said Staff 3 is “nice” to her. Youth B
said Staff 3 holds all youth accountable for their actions however
will always pull youth aside and talk with them and does not do it
in front of other youth. Youth B said she never saw Staff 3 talking
to Youth E or any other youth in a demeaning or inappropriate
manner.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 14, 2025. Youth C said she has never seen or heard of
Staff 3 antagonizing Youth E or any other youth. Youth C referred
to Staff 3 as “understanding” and said he holds youth accountable
and some of the youths do not like that.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 14, 2025. Youth D said Staff 3 never curses or yells at
the youth. Youth D said Staff 3 is straight-forward and does not
5

use favoritism with any youth. Youth D said she never saw or
heard of Staff 3 intentionally making Youth E or any other youth
upset.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on February 10, 2025.
Staff 1 said Youth E did not like Staff 3 and he knew it so most of
the time Staff 3 would keep his distance from Youth E when she
was upset as to not provoke her. Staff 1 said Staff 3 is very
straightforward with all the youth and in his communication which
Youth E did not like and would often try to engage in arguments
with him. Staff 1 said she never saw or heard of Staff 3 cursing at
the youth, making derogatory statements, or intentionally
provoking the youth. Staff 1 said she did not have any concerns in
the way in which Staff 3 interacted with the youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on February 10, 2025.
Staff 2 said she has never seen Staff 3 antagonize or provoke
Youth E or any other youth. Staff 2 said Staff 3 does not always
work closely with Youth E so may not be as aware of some of her
triggers as other staff that work with her daily. Staff 2 said Staff 3
is very straightforward with the youth and will hold all of them
accountable which Youth E does not like.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on February 12, 2025..
Staff 3 said he would never intentionally provoke any youth and
his attempts when engaging youth was to deescalate any
situation. Staff 3 said he is truthful and straightforward with all
youth and some of them do not like that approach and do not want
to be held accountable for their actions. Staff 3 said Youth E did
not like him and made that known so he did not engage with her
often and would have other staff take the lead if possible.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews there was not enough information to support a rule
violation as Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Lead Supervisor, Youth A,
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D all denied Staff 3 verbally abusing
or provoking Youth E in any way.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
6

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
